item.title: Solving Backspace Problem in SSH Client
item.description: When using SSH on a regular basis on all kind of hosts, at some moment you may run into the ‘backspace problem’, effectively not being able to erase characters entered from the keyboard. This is the result of a mismatch between expected and provided capabilities of the terminal. Until recent, I could solve this problem by just setting the terminal environment-variable. This however did not work the last time that I encountered this problem, and I had to find another solution.
